instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON â€“ CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..

threads.title: 820 3209 Macbook Air wont turn on
threads.message:
Hi,
I have a 820 3209  that wont turn on, have green light for 3 sec and then orange without battery connected
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 8.39V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> - 19.88 but fluctuating to 19.99 v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.4V and rapidly changing to 3.6 or 3.9  when I removed <RESISTOR>R7252</RESISTOR>  <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> stayed on 3.9v

And also the fan it seems to want to take of for a half of second and stop and again tries to spin and stop

The board is liquid damaged but before it came to me someone cleaned it with alcohol.
Have no ideea where to start looking.
Thanks

threads.title: 820 3209 Macbook Air wont turn on
threads.message: Start with an ultrasonic cleaning of the board. You cannot trust another guys cleaning with alcohol and toothbrush.

threads.title: 820 3209 Macbook Air wont turn on
threads.message: Any other suggestions? I've done the UC, same thing...

threads.title: 820 3209 Macbook Air wont turn on
threads.message: Can be anything. Does CPU Vcore come up for an instant?

threads.title: 820 3209 Macbook Air wont turn on
threads.message:
So I measured around <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> and on pin 20 it gives me something like  [url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/0ByCXGYbEFlAvUnJjcTc3anBONFE/view?usp=sharing[/url]  
 every voltage seem to be fluctuating on this machine...

I think I have a possessed Air...

threads.title: 820 3209 Macbook Air wont turn on
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> would cause it to turn on and stay on but with no vcore. what is the resistance over <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR>, and also what does the rtc clock chip area look like? both of these are common "easy" causes of quarter fan spin

threads.title: 820 3209 Macbook Air wont turn on
threads.message:
QUOTE=aprendiz;n3715]Probably bad <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> or trace........[/QUOTE]
<RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> is 90.9K

Louis
<CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> is 3.3 ohms and the rtc clock area looks ok

Sorry for the delay of response.

threads.title: 820 3209 Macbook Air wont turn on
threads.message:
So,
based on Louis ideea I've checked resistance over <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> and everything was ok, then I've measured <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> and got 175K so I replaced it then <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> showed me 4.10Mohms, at this point I assumed the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is broken so I replaced it an now I have a good 8.4 V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is stable at 3.9v but is a little bit high (dont know the reason)and the quarter fan spin is gone.

Dont know where to go from here

Edit: quarter fan spin still here but only for 5 sec, missed him first time.

threads.title: 820 3209 Macbook Air wont turn on
threads.message: You first post stater you removed <RESISTOR>R7252</RESISTOR>, did you put it back?

threads.title: 820 3209 Macbook Air wont turn on
threads.message:
Yep, is back on,
I've tried to see if I have something on the EN1 and EN2 pins of <CHIP>U7201</CHIP>
On EN1 0V
On EN2 3.9
If I remove <RESISTOR>R7251</RESISTOR> I get
EN1 5V
EN2 4V

What am I missing?

threads.title: 820 3209 Macbook Air wont turn on
threads.message: Thanks for the help guys, the machine gone back to client unrepaired. No patience = no repair
